author: nashatyrev
content: Hey channel! Are we going to make Gossip v1.1 a part of the spec v.0.12 ?

author: nashatyrev
content:
<@!144468805697929216> Ok, thanks! Missed it cause the protocol version wasn't changed in the spec `/meshsub/1.0.0` 
Shouldn't it also be upgraded to `/meshsub/1.1.0`?
https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-specs/blob/dev/specs/phase0/p2p-interface.md#the-gossip-domain-gossipsub

author: djrtwo
content: <@!425567222635954178> I couldn't find the protocol version changing in the gossipsub specs so I didn't bump it. I think the reason it doesn't change is that v1.1 is fully backwards compatible with v1.0 (and even floodsub!)

author: m.kalinin
content: <@!291925846556540928> it's specified in the overview section https://github.com/libp2p/specs/blob/master/pubsub/gossipsub/gossipsub-v1.1.md#overview

author: m.kalinin
content: > Peers that implement these extensions, advertise v1.1 of the protocol using /meshsub/1.1.0 as the protocol string.
